intro: Cephalanthera × schaberi, commonly known as the hybrid green twayblade, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant that typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments. The plant features a slender, leafless stem that bears a single, showy greenish-white flower. Its roots are specialized for absorbing nutrients from the soil, and it is often found in nutrient-poor habitats. This hybrid species is native to Europe and is characterized by its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
